poem:
Antidepressants

A rhythm reborn,  
in shadowed echoes—  
guitars weave pulse,  
under streetlight skies.  
The voice,  
a whisper cutting glass,  
threads through  
the pulse of night.  
Old barriers break,  
edge meeting edge.  
Unfold the velvet coat,  
music's cloak beneath,  
stitched by hands  
familiar yet new.  
Listen—  
like rain  
on forgotten streets.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Suede: Antidepressants review – edgy post-punk proves reunited Britpoppers remain on the up Suede’s fifth album since their 2013 reformation continues their creative resurgence. Singer Brett Anderson suggests that if 2022’s Autofiction – their best post-reunion album until now – was their punk album, Antidepressants is its post-punk sibling. Influences such as Magazine, Joy Division and Siouxsie and the Banshees feed into edgier but otherwise trademark Suede guitar anthems. Helmed again by longtime producer Ed". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Suede: Antidepressants review – edgy post-punk proves reunited Britpoppers remain on the up Suede’s fifth album since their 2013 reformation continues their creative resurgence. Singer Brett Anderson suggests that if 2022’s Autofiction – their best post-reunion album until now – was their punk album, Antidepressants is its post-punk sibling. Influences such as Magazine, Joy Division and Siouxsie and the Banshees feed into edgier but otherwise trademark Suede guitar anthems. Helmed again by longtime producer Ed
